data.title: Erie County got 5.6 inches of snow Friday. Here's how much new snow to expect Saturday
data.meta_description: Friday delivered 5.6 inches of snow to Erie County. Saturday could offer up more of the same in some areas.
data.text:
Friday delivered 5.6 inches of snow to Erie County. Saturday could offer up more of the same.

The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a winter storm warning for Erie and Crawford counties through Sunday at 4 a.m. A warning also has been issued in Ashtabula County, Ohio, and advisories are in place in Venango, Mercer and Forest counties and in Chautauqua County, New York.

How much snow will Erie and Crawford counties get?

The weather service warning for Erie and Crawford counties calls for heavy snow in some places around the region Saturday. Total new accumulations of 2 inches to 7 inches are possible. The greatest snowfall is likely to occur in inland Erie County.

There is a 90% chance of snow showers Saturday. Snow showers are likely Saturday night as well. The high will be near 21 and the low around 20.

Sunday will be mostly cloudy with a high near 27 and a low around 18. There is a 40% chance of snow showers, mainly before noon.

Record cold remembered: Lowest air temperature recorded in Erie was 30 years ago

Erie County's monthly and seasonal snowfall totals got a boost Friday with 5.6 inches of new snow. Still, just 13.6 inches have fallen since Jan. 1, or 6.9 inches off the average through Jan. 19, according to weather service data. Just 15 inches have fallen since Dec. 1, or 31.8 inches below average.

What's the snow forecast for the rest of northwestern Pa.?

A winter weather advisory is in place through Sunday at 1 a.m. for Venango, Mercer and Forest counties. The weather service in Pittsburgh calls for an inch or 2 across the area, with isolated bands where 3 inches to 4 inches of new snow could fall.

The weather service in Buffalo has issued a winter weather advisory for Chautauqua County, New York, through Sunday at 7 a.m. Four inches to 8 inches is possible around around the Chautauqua Ridge and 2 inches to 4 inches elsewhere.

The weather service in Cleveland has a winter storm warning in place for Ashtabula County, Ohio, until Saturday at 10 p.m. Total snow accumulations of 1 inch to 5 inches are possible, with the heaviest snow in the eastern part of the county Saturday morning.
